items.title: Glasner hopes to gee up jaded Palace as he eyes Carabao Cup revenge over Arsenal
items.summary: Tuesday‚Äôs quarter-final will be the Eagles‚Äô 29th game of the season and Gabriel Jesus is set to line up against them Oliver Glasner could be forgiven for preferring to enjoy a rest with his family in Austria a few days before Christmas rather than preparing for Crystal Palace‚Äôs 29th game of the season ‚Äì a Carabao Cup quarter-final against Arsenal on Tuesday night. However, any suggestion that Palace may have to prioritise given they remain in four competitions was unsurprisingly dismissed. ‚ÄúNo, I don‚Äôt think so,‚Äù said Glasner after his team‚Äôs 4-1 hammering by Leeds on Saturday. ‚ÄúIf somebody tells me that we lose on purpose, the next day I‚Äôm not the manager any more.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: Peter Bosz als bondscoach? 'Geen garantie op direct droomvoetbal'
items.summary: Er is een lobby gaande voor Peter Bosz als bondscoach. In Rondje Eredivisie bespreken Martijn Krabbendam, Geert-Jan Jakobs en Inta Janssen wie na het WK de nieuwe bondscoach moet worden. Kan de huidige PSV-trainer het droomvoetbal bij Oranje brengen waar iedereen zo naar verlangt?

items.title: Dalot: Fernandes injury 'massive' blow to Utd
items.summary: Diogo Dalot called Bruno Fernandes' injury a "massive" blow as Manchester United wait to find out the severity of the skipper's setback.

items.title: Kane smashes Arjen Robben record in Bayern rout
items.summary: Harry Kane scored his 30th club goal of the season as Bayern Munich shrugged off an injury and illness crisis to sweep past Heidenheim 4-0 on Sunday and go into the Bundesliga's winter break with a nine-point lead.

items.title: Arteta: Jesus could start in cup against Palace
items.summary: Mikel Arteta hinted he was ready to hand Gabriel Jesus his first start in 345 days in Arsenal's Carabao Cup quarterfinal clash against Crystal Palace.

items.title: Man United's Mazaroui 'fantastic' in Hakimi role
items.summary: Achraf Hakimi was unable to make his comeback from injury in Morocco's opener at the Africa Cup of Nations on Sunday -- a 2-0 victory over Comoros -- but head coach Walid Regragui said his replacement is just as strong an option.

items.title: Transfers Feyenoord: 'Brentford kijkt opnieuw in Rotterdam rond'
items.summary: Ook buiten de transferperiode om volgt VI het transfernieuws bij Feyenoord op de voet, ook omdat het sneller dan je denkt alweer januari is. De doelwitten van de Rotterdammers, duiding van de clubwatcher, of aandacht in buitenlandse media. We verzamelen alles hier.

items.title: Hoe Dickie-taka ontstond in Chili: 'Spelers dachten: wat gaan we nu doen?'
items.summary: Dick Schreuder staat in Nederland bekend om zijn aanvallende en onorthodoxe speelwijze bij NEC. De trainer ontwikkelde zijn visie door de jaren heen, waarbij er een grote rol is weggelegd voor twee voormalig bondscoaches van Chili.

items.title: Liverpool win again, but lose Isak to injury. Now what? Plus: Bar√ßa ride their luck, more
items.summary: Liverpool won a third straight game, but Alexander Isak's injury and some familiar issues mean the Reds still have a lot of work to do.

items.title: 'Everton gaat poging doen voor Zirkzee'
items.summary: In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in het buitenland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in Nederland.

items.title: England name squad for away series against South Africa
items.summary: The Vitality Roses have named their squad for their three-match test series away to South Africa in January.

items.title: 'Dat Robin van Persie zich na afloop positief uit is zorgwekkend'
items.summary: Nooit eerder kreeg Feyenoord zo veel kansen tegen voor rust. Het gebeurde in de wedstrijd tegen FC Twente tegen wie Feyenoord verrassend een punt uit het duel sleepte. 29 schoten waarvan 11 op doel in de hele wedstrijd zijn zorgwekkende cijfers voor de Rotterdammers. Komt dit nog goed? En wat zegt het mediaoptreden van Robin van Persie over de verwachtingen van de club? Dat en meer bespreken Martijn Krabbendam, Geert-Jan Jakobs en Inta Janssen in Rondje Eredivisie.

items.title: Villarreal tried everything against Barcelona ‚Äì except moving the game to Miami | Sid Lowe
items.summary: In a match mercifully on Spanish soil, Villarreal bombarded Bar√ßa but were undone by profligacy and ill-discipline Marcelino Garc√≠a Toral came bounding down the steps like an excited schoolboy when the bell goes. He flew past the substitutes and staff, skidded left, and sprinted up the line all wide-eyed and excited, shaking his fists and beaming. He had gone 15 or 20 metres, maybe 25 when he realised ‚Äì just a fraction later than everyone else ‚Äì that something had gone wrong again. So Villarreal‚Äôs manager put the brakes on and his head down, and turned back towards the bench feeling almost as silly as this was getting. This, he already suspected, was going to be one of those days. They had been playing 16 minutes and the goal Villarreal had scored, the goal Jules Kound√© scored for them, wasn‚Äôt a goal at all. Just as the chance they made after 80 seconds wasn‚Äôt, Nicolas P√©p√© putting wide from a yard out. Just as Ayoze P√©rez‚Äôs opportunity on six minutes wasn‚Äôt a goal, Tajon Buchanan‚Äôs effort on 13 wasn‚Äôt, and Raphinha‚Äôs on nine minutes was. One moment ‚Äì a dash, a tumble and a penalty and from nowhere Villarreal trailed Barcelona as two of La Liga‚Äôs best teams met on the Mediterranean, not in Miami. Barcelona beat Villarreal 2-0. Continue reading...

items.title: McCullum concedes England future 'up to other people' after 11-day Ashes series defeat
items.summary: Brendon McCullum is eager to stay on as England's head coach but admits his future is "up to other people" after losing the Ashes in just 11 days.

items.summary: Micky van de Ven faced no action for the challenge which led to Alexander Isak's injury in Liverpool's win at Tottenham - but did the officials make the right call?
